climbs.name: Who Needs Friends
climbs.fa: Chris Schmick and Greg Thomas (sport) Andy Boone and Dan Caldwell (trad)

content.description: Overhung the whole way.  Make awkward hard moves to full body rest 20' feet up.  Take a deep breath and climb the steep crack using jams and face holds to a pumpy and slightly run-out finish above bomber gear.   The route is called "Who Needs Friends" because it was bolted.  IMHO I think it climbs nicely as a trad route.
content.protection: Bring a large piece (#4 or #5 camalot) for the beginning and then varied sizes the rest of the way (yellow alien through #3 camalot) or just clip the 6 bolts to 2 bolt anchor.

content.description: New route between Mod Squad and Flinging the Hog.  The start is pretty easy, so it’s easy to mistake for Mod if you don’t know the area/have a guidebook.  Felt a bit harder than Mod, maybe 9+/10-.  Tricky crux pulling the bulge.
content.protection: Bolted like a gym - 10+ 2 for the anchors.
content.location: First route on the face around the corner from the obvious, chalked 10d around the corner.  Mod Squad is to the left.

content.description: Start 6 ft. right of corner and go right at the 3rd bolt.  Fun!
content.location: Same start as Everybody needs friends.  First route on right side of wall.

content.description: Easy 5.11 climbing to mantle...should have ended at the lip for a better route.
content.location: New route to the right of Tasmanian Devil.

content.description: Climb is just right of the crack.  Move right on to the face.  Hard would be a good way to explain it.
A great hard route for someone who wants to sample the goods.  Climb starts in grey streak 20ft left of crack, and climbs right of the big tree.
Easy route left of "Flingin' the Hog", warm up for the area. Fun moves, I did alot of palming.
Another hard route to finish of this pumpy wall.  Left most climb on wall.  Climb left of the big tree.
Start halfway between the crack and the corner.  Good climb.
Climb is in the corner left of the Beaver Wall.  Fun moves to the top!  A good route to warm up on for the rest of the hard routes.
content.location: Between corner and arete, left of the Beaver Wall.

content.description: Fun climbing until the last bolt, then things go south. No idea what you're supposed to do here, but whatever you do you're gonna need a wire brush because everything up above the last bolt is filthy and covered in moss and dirt (as of 10/12/15). But its only for about two moves. Have fun.
content.location: Next route right of Flingin Hog, first and leftmost route on the main beaver wall. Left of "Legends of the Fall"

content.description: Same start as Tasmania Devil, but climb left at 3rd bolt.  Great route, with fun pumpy moves.
content.location: Same start as Tasmania Devil.  First bolted lines on right side of wall.

content.description: Overhanging high quality sport lines with one 5.12a trad route.  The wall is in the sun AM through the afternoon.  The routes range from 5.11a - 5.13a.
